alert.note: Alert for Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 24 at 6:43AM CST until February 25 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT LAKE ENHANCED SNOW NEAR LAKE MICHIGAN TONIGHT... .A strong upper level disturbance and cold northeast flow off lake Michigan will combine to produce significant snow accumulations across the lakeshore counties tonight. The snow may be heavy at times in the late evening and overnight hours. Travel will become hazardous due to poor visibility and snow covered roads. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected, locally heavy at times in the late evening and overnight hours. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Manitowoc, Door and Kewaunee Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are likely tonight, due to locally heavy snow, poor visibility and snow covered roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake-effect snow showers will occur in parts of the lakeshore counties this morning, with accumulations of 1 to 2 inches and locally higher amounts. However, the most significant accumulations and worst travel conditions are anticipated tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
